title: Unauthorized access to PII leads to MASS account Takeover
content:
Hi, I hope you doing well
I found a critical endpoint which disclosed the personal information which can use to takeover any account present on https://██████████
#Steps:
Visit the link https://www.████████/███████ you will get my details, including first name and last name, mobile number and email_address related to the account.
Go to the forgot password link present at https://www.███████/ click on it.
Enter the mail address later you will be taken to another page which will ask you to enter mail address and pin
After entering mail address enter the pin as "████" as █████████ is at the endpoint.
It will validate and will ask you to change the password of that account.
Note: To get email list and pin list just decrease the number at the endpoint
for example https://www.████████/███will give you another mail_address and pin will be ██████████
Impact
An attacker can able to takeover any account that is present on that side.
steps: Visit the link https://www.████████/███████ to retrieve personal information (first name, last name, mobile number, email address) associated with an account.
Navigate to the forgot password link at https://www.███████/ and enter the email address obtained from step 1.
On the subsequent page, enter the email address again and use the static PIN '████' (retrieved from the same endpoint) to bypass authentication.
Change the account password to complete the takeover.
To enumerate other accounts, decrement the number in the endpoint URL (e.g., https://www.████████/███) to fetch additional email addresses and corresponding static PINs.
vuln_description: The vulnerability involves an information disclosure flaw where an endpoint exposes sensitive personal information (PII) and static PINs, enabling account takeover via the password reset functionality. Attackers can exploit this to hijack any account by iterating through predictable endpoint variations.
reason: The attack relies on straightforward enumeration of predictable endpoints and reuse of static PINs, with no complex interactions or state manipulation required. The vulnerability is easily discoverable through basic probing of the application.
